text: ان فى ذلك لءاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين

translations.translation: Verily there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
Surely there is a Sign in this, but most of them would not believe.
Indeed in this is surely a sign, and most of them were not Muslims.
Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
Most surely there is a sign in this, but most of them do not believe.
Surely in that is a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.
Surely in that there is a sign; yet most of them do not believe:
Verily herein is a sign; but most of them are not believers.
There is indeed a sign in that, but most of them do not have faith.
Verily in this is a Sign: but most of them do not believe.
Verily! In this is indeed a sign (or a proof), yet most of them are not believers.
Surely, in that there is a sign; yet most of them do not believe.
In that there is a sign, but most of them are not believers.
Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

[26:67] Surely in that, drowning of Pharaoh and his folk, there is a sign, a lesson for those [generations] who would come after them; but most of them are not believers, in God. The only ones to believe were Āsiya — Pharaoh’s wife — Hizqīl, the believing man of Pharaoh’s family, and Maryam daughter of Nāmūsī, she who pointed out the bone remains of [the prophet] Joseph, peace be upon him.
(Lo! Herein) in that which We did to them (is indeed a portent) a sign and an admonition, (yet most of them are not believers) most of them were not believers.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { إِنَّ فِي ذَلِكَ } الإنجاء والإغراق { لآيَةً } دالة على كمال قدرة الله، ومتانة حكمته بالنسبة إلى ذوي البصائر والاعتبار، المشمرين ذيل الغناية والاهتمام نحو التفكر والتدبر في آثار أوصاف الفاعل المختار { وَ } لكن { مَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم } أي: ما أكثر الناس المجبولين على فطرة الاستدلال والاعتبار { مُّؤْمِنِينَ } [الشعراء: 67] بالله وتوحيده وأسمائه حتى يتأملوا في آثار صفاته؛ ليستدلوا على ذاته
